meanings.definition: To make provincial in character or scope.
meanings.sent1: She provincializes her writing by focusing only on local topics.
meanings.sent2: The author provincializes her novels by setting them in small towns.
meanings.sent3: The way he talks about his small town provincializes his whole persona.
meanings.sent4: Her narrow-mindedness provincializes her view of the world.
meanings.sent5: The limited perspective provincializes the entire narrative.

meanings.definition: To treat as provincial or of local interest.
meanings.sent1: He provincializes the cultural differences between cities.
meanings.sent2: The museum provincializes the artifacts from the region.
meanings.sent3: Treating international news as local gossip provincializes the importance of global events.
meanings.sent4: She provincializes the significance of historical events by focusing only on local stories.
meanings.sent5: The teacher provincializes the students' understanding of geography by only discussing their hometown.
